Description: THE SOUTH ATLANTIC FISHERY MANAGEMENT COUNCIL WILL 1) EXPAND GEOGRAPHICAL AND TEMPORAL RANGE OF THE FISHSTORY CITIZEN SCIENCE PROJECT IN SUPPORT OF DEVELOPING ABUNDANCE INDICES FOR STOCK ASSESSMENTS OF SOUTH ATLANTIC SPECIES; 2) IMPROVE EFFICIENCY OF DATA COLLECTION AND PHOTO PROCESSING; 3) ESTIMATE LENGTH COMPOSITIONS FOR MULTIPLE SPECIES USING THE PROTOCOLS DEVELOPED DURING THE PILOT PROJECT WITH FOCUS ON RED SNAPPER AND KING MACKEREL; AND 4) IMPLEMENT AN OUTREACH AND ENGAGEMENT STRATEGY TO RETAIN FISHSTORY'S CURRENT VOLUNTEER BASE AND RECRUIT NEW USERS.

THE PROJECT WILL REPLACE SEVERAL UTILITIES USED TO ACCESS NORTH CAROLINA'S BIOLOGICAL DATABASE WITH A WEB-BASED APPLICATION TO WORK WITH A MODERN DATABASE IN MICROSOFT SQL SERVER FOR INCREASED EFFICIENCY OF BUSINESS PROCESS FOR THE DIVISION AND TO MEET CURRENT SECURITY REQUIREMENTS OF THE STATE. FUNCTIONALITY TO BE UPDATED INCLUDE DATA EXTRACTION AND QUERYING, DATA ENTRY AND EDITING, QA/QC, AND REPORTING.

THE RECREATIONAL ANGLING COMMUNITY HAS BEEN ASKING TO HAVE A FEEDBACK MECHANISM FOR DISCARD DATA OVER THE PAST TEN YEARS, THE MOST COMMON OF WHICH HAS BEEN FOR BLACK SEA BASS AND STRIPED BASS - TWO SPECIES WITH HIGH DISCARD RATES. THIS STUDY WILL COLLECT RECREATIONAL CATCH AND EFFORT DATA FROM ANGLERS WHO ARE UTILIZING COMMERCIALLY AVAILABLE LOGBOOK APPLICATIONS ACTING AS CITIZEN SCIENTISTS TO PROVIDE DATA THAT IS CURRENTLY LACKING BY CURRENT COLLECTION METHODS. THIS PROJECT WILL DEVELOP AND TEST THE INFRASTRUCTURE REQUIRED TO COLLECT RECREATIONAL FISHING DATA FOR THE PURPOSES OF FISHERIES MANAGEMENT. IN ADDITION TO CREATING A DATA PIPELINE FOR THE COLLECTION OF DATA FROM MULTIPLE MOBILE RECREATIONAL FISHING APPLICATIONS, THE APPLICATIONS WILL BE ENHANCED WITH FEATURES THAT MOTIVATE ANGLERS TO USE THE APPLICATIONS TO REPORT DATA, AND OUTREACH PROGRAMS WILL BE IMPLEMENTED TO ENCOURAGE GREATER REPORTING OF DATA AMONG RECREATIONAL ANGLERS IN RHODE ISLAND AND SURROUNDING AREAS. RI DEM WILL

THE MAIN OBJECTIVES OF THIS PROJECT ARE TO IMPLEMENT A PILOT OBSERVER PROGRAM WITHIN RHODE ISLAND STATE WATERS FOR THE GILLNET FISHERY AND COLLECT EFFORT DATA TO CHARACTERIZE THE FISHING BEHAVIOR OF THE RHODE ISLAND GILLNET FISHERY. THE RHODE ISLAND DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL MANAGEMENT (RI DEM) IS PARTNERING WITH MASSACHUSETTS DIVISION OF MARINE FISHERIES (DMF) TO USE THIS PROJECT TO ANALYZE DATA COLLECTED AND CONDUCT MODELING TO INVESTIGATE THE UTILITY OF WEEKLY AGGREGATE LIMITS IN REDUCING DISCARDS, THE POTENTIAL FOR INCREASED EFFORT FOR ACTIVE GILLNET FISHERS, THE SIZE DISTRIBUTION OF DISCARDED TARGET SPECIES, AND THE SEASONALITY OF PULSE FISHERIES. ADDITIONALLY, THIS PROJECT WILL BE USED TO DETERMINE THE FEASIBILITY OF A STATE WATERS OBSERVER PROGRAM FOR ALL COMMERCIAL GEAR TYPES. OBSERVERS WILL COLLECT DISCARD DATA ON TARGET SPECIES INCLUDING ATLANTIC MENHADEN, STRIPED BASS, BLUEFISH, BLACK SEA BASS, SUMMER FLOUNDER, WINTER SKATE, LITTLE SKATE, AND SPINY DOGFISH. DISCARD DATA WI

IMPROVE THE QUANTITY AND QUALITY OF DATA COLLECTED ON FISHES LANDED BY THE COMMERCIAL AND RECREATIONAL FISHERIES OPERATING ON FLORIDA'S ATLANTIC COAST AND INCORPORATE THESE AND OTHER DATA INTO COMPREHENSIVE STOCK ASSESSMENTS THAT CAN BE USED IN THE MANAGEMENT OF FISHERIES RESOURCES. FWC STAFF WILL CONDUCT:  1) BIOSTATISTICAL SAMPLING, 2) DEVELOPMENT OF INPUT DATA NEEDED FOR STOCK ASSESSMENTS, AND 3) DEVELOPMENT AND REVIEW OF COMPLIANCE REPORTS AND STOCK ASSESSMENTS.

THE SOUTH CAROLINA DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES (SCDNR), WILL EXECUTE TWO GENERALIZED EFFORTS THROUGHOUT THIS PROJECT PERIOD, PRIMARILY SUPPORTING AND ENHANCING FISHERIES MANAGEMENT PLANNING BY COLLECTING AND ANALYZING OF FISHERIES DATA. THE FIRST EFFORT PERTAINS TO FISHERY MANAGEMENT PLAN (FMP) ACTIVITIES AND HAS THE GREATEST OVERALL IMPACT. SCDNR STAFF WILL CONTINUE TO ASSIST IN DEVELOPING, IMPLEMENTING, AND MONITORING  PLANS AND POLICIES TO PROTECT, CONSERVE, AND ENHANCE ALL INTERJURISDICTIONAL MARINE AND ESTUARINE FISHERIES MANAGED BY THE ATLANTIC STATES MARINE FISHERIES COMMISSION (ASMFC).  THE SECOND EFFORT FOCUSES ON SPECIAL STUDIES DIRECTED AT CRITICAL FISHERIES WHERE DATA COLLECTION EFFORTS NEED TO BE CONCENTRATED IN SOUTH CAROLINA (SC).  SPECIFICALLY, MAJOR EMPHASIS WILL BE PLACED ON DIADROMOUS FISHERIES WORK.  ADDITIONALLY,   TO GAIN A MORE COMPLETE UNDERSTANDING OF THE HARVEST IMPACT FROM FISHERMEN, THE SCDNR OFFICE OF FISHERIES MANAGEMENT (OFM) WILL ISSUE LICENSES AND/O

THIS PROJECT WILL CONTINUE DEVELOPMENT OF AN API-BASED INTEGRATION OF GEOGRAPHICAL VESSEL-MONITORING DATA WITH REAL-TIME ELECTRONICALLY REPORTED DATA FOR SMALL SCALE INSHORE FISHERIES IN THE ETRIPS MOBILE APPLICATION AND THROUGH AN ACCSP HOSTED WEB-BASED ADMINISTRATIVE APPLICATION. THIS PROJECT WILL EVALUATE FUNCTIONALITY OF ADDITIONAL VMS DEVICES NOT TESTED IN PHASE 1 IN ORDER TO COMPLETE TECHNICAL ANALYSIS OF ALL CURRENTLY AVAILABLE CELLULAR DEVICES; DEVELOP STRAWMAN REQUIREMENTS FOR FUTURE CELLULAR AND/OR LOW-COST SATELLITE VMS DEVICES TO MEET ACCSP STANDARDS FOR INTEGRATION INTO THE PROGRAM. THIS STEP WILL BE CARRIED OUT IN COLLABORATION WITH THE ACCSP DATA TEAM. ADDITIONALLY, THIS WILL NEGATE THE NEED FOR FUTURE TESTING OF CELLULAR UNITS AS THEY BECOME AVAILABLE ON THE MARKET.  IT WILL ALSO ANALYZE APPROVAL PROCEDURES FOR FEDERAL VMS PRODUCTS IN LIGHT OF NEW INSHORE CELLULAR OPTIONS AND PENDING LOBSTER/JONAH CRAB FISHERY REGULATIONS. COMPARE APPROVAL PROCEDURES FOR FEDERAL VMS PRO

THIS STUDY WILL PROVIDE NEW AND EXISTING RHODE ISLAND (RI) SEAFOOD DEALERS WITH TECHNICAL SUPPORT TO MAINTAIN AND IMPROVE DEALER ELECTRONIC REPORTING TO THE STANDARD ATLANTIC FISHERIES INFORMATION SYSTEM (SAFIS) PURSUANT TO RI MARINE FISHERIES STATUTES AND REGULATIONS; PROVIDE TECHNICAL AND ANALYTICAL SUPPORT TO THE RI MARINE FISHERIES QUOTA MONITORING PROGRAM AS WELL AS MAINTAIN DEALER COMPLIANCE MONITORING PROTOCOLS FOR BOTH QUOTA AND NON-QUOTA MANAGED SPECIES BY UTILIZING COMMERCIAL LANDINGS DATA FROM SAFIS; COLLECT AND ENHANCE TRIP-LEVEL CATCH AND EFFORT DATA THROUGH THE RI MARINE FISHERIES COMMERCIAL HARVESTER CATCH AND EFFORT LOGBOOK PROGRAM AND THE RI ELECTRONIC RECREATIONAL LOGBOOK (ELOGBOOK) PROGRAM AND CONTINUE TO TRANSITION COMMERCIAL FISHERMEN TO ELECTRONIC TRIP REPORTING; AND MAINTAIN AND IMPROVE THE EXISTING DATA FEED OF RI SUPPLEMENTAL FISHERIES DATA TO THE ACCSP DATA WAREHOUSE.

THIS STUDY WILL DETERMINE THE GENETIC STOCK COMPOSITION OF AMERICAN SHAD IN THE DIRECTED MIXED STOCK FISHERY IN THE LOWER DELAWARE BAY IN SUPPORT OF UNDERSTANDING THE EFFECTS OF OUT OF BASIN HARVEST ON RIVER SPECIFIC AMERICAN SHAD STOCKS THROUGH DNA ANALYSIS; AND EVALUATE BY-CATCH AND DISCARDS IN NEW JERSEY'S DELAWARE BAY GILL NET FISHERIES TO SUPPLEMENT AND VERIFY DATA COLLECTED FROM COMMERCIAL HARVESTER REPORTS THROUGH ON-BOARD FISHERIES OBSERVERS.

IN AN EFFORT TO GAIN A BETTER UNDERSTANDING OF THE POPULATION DYNAMICS AND GROWTH RATES OF INVASIVE FLATHEAD CATFISH IN DISTRICT WATERS OF THE UPPER POTOMAC RIVER, THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA'S DEPARTMENT OF ENERGY & ENVIRONMENT (DOEE) WILL CONTINUE A PIT TAG STUDY ESTABLISHED IN 2017. THIS ENABLES DOEE BIOLOGISTS TO MONITOR TAG DATA FROM FLATHEAD CATFISH CAPTURED IN THE DISTRICT PORTIONS OF THE POTOMAC AND ANACOSTIA RIVERS FOR A CONTINUOUS PERIOD OF FIVE YEARS.

THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROPOSAL IS TO COMPLY WITH ADDENDUM XXVI OF THE ATLANTIC STATES MARINE FISHERIES COMMISSION'S AMERICAN LOBSTER FISHERIES MANAGEMENT PLAN WHICH REQUIRES MEDMR TO INCREASE THE PERCENTAGE OF TRIP LEVEL LANDINGS INFORMATION COLLECTED FROM COMMERCIAL LOBSTER HARVESTERS FROM 10% 
(APPROXIMATELY 600 HARVESTERS) TO 100% (APPROXIMATELY 6,000 HARVESTERS). THE PRIMARY TASKS WILL BE TO ENFORCE COMPLIANCE IN REPORTING, DATA ENTRY, DATA AUDITS, AND INDUSTRY OUTREACH AND TRAINING.

THIS PROJECT CONTINUES THE INCREASED USE OF CENSUS-STYLE REPORTING BY EXPANDING THE USE OF ACCSP ETRIPS TECHNOLOGY AMONG A GROUP OF PRFC COMMERCIAL OYSTER, CRAB, AND FINFISH LICENSE HOLDERS AND EVALUATING THE EFFICACY OF THIS METHOD COMPARED TO TRADITIONAL METHODS.  PRFC WILL EXPAND ITS PARTICIPATION RATE AND UPDATE/IMPROVE TRAINING PROCESSES AND MATERIALS FOR HARVESTERS.  ADDITIONALLY, PRFC WILL MAINTAIN A CONTRACT WITH A SOFTWARE DEVELOPMENT PROVIDER TO CONTINUE TO MAINTAIN RELEVANT INTERFACES AND THE DEVELOPMENT OF AN UPGRADED CLOUD APPLICATION.

THIS PROJECT CONTINUES DEVELOPMENT OF AN APPLICATION PROGRAMMING INTERFACE-BASED INTEGRATION OF GEOGRAPHICAL VESSEL-MONITORING DATA WITH REAL-TIME ELECTRONICALLY REPORTED DATA FOR SMALL SCALE INSHORE FISHERIES IN THE ETRIPS MOBILE APPLICATION AND THROUGH AN ACCSP HOSTED WEB-BASED ADMINISTRATIVE APPLICATION.

THIS STUDY WILL CONTINUE THE BIOLOGICAL COMMERCIAL CATCH SAMPLING OF ATLANTIC HERRING, ATLANTIC MACKEREL, AND ATLANTIC MENHADEN IN MAINE. ADDITIONALLY, OTHER SPECIES OF INTEREST, SUCH AS DOGFISH, BOTH RIVER HERRING SPECIES, AND SHAD WILL BE SAMPLED AS THEY ARE ROUTINELY ENCOUNTERED IN THIS STUDY. THIS PROPOSAL WILL ALSO CONTINUE TO SURVEY BYCATCH DURING TRIPS TARGETING ATLANTIC HERRING USING THE PROTOCOLS DEVELOPED OVER THE LAST DECADE OF SAMPLING.  COMMERCIAL CATCH SAMPLING WILL BE CONDUCTED AT HERRING AND MACKEREL PUMPING AND PROCESSING SITES ALONG THE MAINE COAST. COMMERCIAL CATCH SAMPLING WILL COMPLY WITH NMFS, ATLANTIC STATES MARINE FISHERY COMMISSION, AND ACCSP PROTOCOLS BY SPECIES. BYCATCH SAMPLING TAKES PLACE AT CENTRALIZED PROCESSING PLANTS AND BAIT DEALERS. A GOAL OF OBSERVING TWO TRIPS PER MONTH FROM JANUARY THROUGH MAY AND ONE OR TWO TRIPS PER WEEK DURING THE JUNE - OCTOBER PERIOD (WHEN THE HERRING FISHERY IS MOST ACTIVE) IS PROPOSED. TRIP SELECTION WILL BE HAPHAZARD,

THIS PROPOSAL IS THE CONTINUING IMPLEMENTATION OF A COMPREHENSIVE DEALER REPORTING REGULATION IN MAINE FOR ALL DEALERS WHO BUY DIRECTLY FROM HARVESTERS. ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE REGULATION COMPLIANCE AND ENFORCEMENT, DATA ENTRY AND AUDITING, AND OUTREACH TO DEALERS. THE PRIMARY GOAL OF THIS PROJECT IS TO CONTINUE COLLECTION OF TRIP LEVEL LANDINGS INFORMATION FROM ALL LICENSED MAINE SEAFOOD DEALERS.
